title: Console Error when using Get Custom Attribute Node on a Mesh Input.
body:
Hi, first thanks for that great addon that is Animation Nodes.

I'm on Windows 10 and I'm using Blender 3.4.1 release with the latest Animation Nodes Release downloaded here:

https://github.com/JacquesLucke/animation_nodes/releases/tag/master-cd-build

I'm trying to get custom attributes out of a Mesh Object Input, however I'm getting the following error in Blender's Console Window as soon as I wire a Mesh Object Input Node and Get Custom Attribute Node:

    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "C:\Users\yyy\AppData\Roaming\Blender Foundation\Blender\3.4\scripts\addons\animation_nodes\execution\main_execution_unit.py", line 38, in executeUnit
    exec(self.executeCodeObject, self.executionData, self.executionData)
      File "execution: 'AN Tree'", line 24, in <module>
      File "C:\Users\yyy\AppData\Roaming\Blender Foundation\Blender\3.4\scripts\addons\animation_nodes\nodes\mesh\mesh_object_input.py", line 214, in loadCustomAttributes
    sourceMesh.an.getCustomAttribute(customAttributeName)))
      File "C:\Users\yyy\AppData\Roaming\Blender Foundation\Blender\3.4\scripts\addons\animation_nodes\extend_bpy_types.py", line 135, in getCustomAttribute
    data = BooleanList(False, length = amount)
      File "animation_nodes\data_structures\lists\base_lists.pyx", line 7202, in animation_nodes.data_structures.lists.base_lists.BooleanList.__cinit__
    TypeError: __cinit__() got multiple values for keyword argument 'length'

Here is a simple project illustrating the issue:

https://github.com/Mparaiso/pixelartdesigner/blob/master/getcustomattribute.blend

![screen](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1152066/226442792-6ed5fc77-fe0b-47e2-814f-22d4ed0ba447.png)

title: Animation node values not updated on render animation
body:
From https://blender.stackexchange.com/q/285322/50044#comment490755_285322.

> # Issue
> 
> Render with <kbd>ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>F12</kbd> always shows the value in timeline at the time of render (`10.0`), but want current frame number. How can I fix number shown in animation render (important: must not be static render) to be frame number?
> 
> Seeking in timeline with `Sequencer and Preview` works fine.
> 
> All frames of render are:
> 
> [![render][1]][1]
> 
> but want `1.0` for frame #1, `2.0` for frame #2, and so on.
> 
> # Attempted solve
> 
> - Nodes: `Overview` --> `Bake to Keyframes`
> - Use older animation nodes: [Python version mismatch](https://blender.stackexchange.com/q/264417/50044)
> 
> 
> # Setup
> 
> ## VSE
> 
> - Add text strip
> 
> [![vse][2]][2]
> 
> 
> ## Animation nodes
> 
> - Add nodes and connect: `Time Info:Frame` --> `Data:Convert to Text:Text` --> `Text:Text Sequence Output`
> 
> [![nodes][3]][3]
> 
> 
> # Environment
> 
> - Blender: latest ([3.4.1 for Linux](https://www.blender.org/download/release/Blender3.4/blender-3.4.1-linux-x64.tar.xz/))
> - Animation nodes: latest ([`animation_nodes_v2_3_linux_py310.zip`](https://github.com/JacquesLucke/animation_nodes/releases/download/master-cd-build/animation_nodes_v2_3_linux_py310.zip))
> 
> 
> # References
> 
> Based on https://blender.stackexchange.com/a/73975
> 
> 
>   [1]: https://i.stack.imgur.com/ZI6NZ.jpg
>   [2]: https://i.stack.imgur.com/FQuVH.png
>   [3]: https://i.stack.imgur.com/kariu.png

title: Using multiple script subprograms causes Errors
body:
When adding script subprogram nodes (ca. 3-5), the tree often gets it's red error frame. Usually deleting the new script node solves this, but when it has happened once, I can't add any more script nodes. 

  File "execution: 'NodeTree'", line 3, in <module>
NameError: name '_subprogram_jt3dtw48882bgu0' is not defined

Apparently when I quit Blender, load a afile with a working node tree, I can rescue my file by reloading it afterwards, but at this point I still can't add any more script nodes.

title: Tempo Track of Midi Nodes of Animation Nodes are not properly taken into account.
body:
Hi!

When I saw that Animation Nodes was extended with midi capabilities, I was very excited!

FINALLY I could use midi in Bender!

I used it in the following video.

https://youtu.be/VHCbmKka58w

However, when I tried to use it in a Blender version of this: 

https://youtu.be/GaDvGbixwz0?t=147

It messed up the timing completely. The end notes were all over the place! They were shifted far to the back!

The midi file at this position has a lot of tempo change events in the tempo track.

The midi file reader does nót take that properly into account.

This is a HUGE ISSUE for me!

In the Mozart animation, this was not a problem, because that file contained just one tempo event in the tempo track.

Has any work been done yet to remedy this problem?

title: [KeyError: 10] when "Read Midi File" Node parses some midi file
body:
When I try to parse a midi file ([canon-2-03m02s.zip](https://github.com/JacquesLucke/animation_nodes/files/6524237/canon-2-03m02s.zip)) with the "Read MIDI File" Node, it raises `KeyError: 10` as shown below (at last line):
- It seems that some event in this midi file is not covered and recognized by the script
- Or maybe it parses some previous bytes incorrectly so that it takes the subsequent byte "10" as an event number, which in fact is not a valid input
- I use Blender 2.92 and Animation Nodes 2.2.2

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\Users\***\AppData\Roaming\Blender Foundation\Blender\2.92\scripts\addons\animation_nodes\execution\main_execution_unit.py", line 38, in executeUnit

    return readMIDIFile(path)
  File "C:\Users\***\AppData\Roaming\Blender Foundation\Blender\2.92\scripts\addons\animation_nodes\utils\midi.py", line 15, in readMIDIFile
    return readMIDIFileCached(path, lastModification)
  File "C:\Users\***\AppData\Roaming\Blender Foundation\Blender\2.92\scripts\addons\animation_nodes\utils\midi.py", line 107, in readMIDIFileCached
    midiFile = MidiFile.fromFile(path)
  File "C:\Users\***\AppData\Roaming\Blender Foundation\Blender\2.92\scripts\addons\animation_nodes\libs\midiparser\parser.py", line 143, in fromFile
    tracks = parseTracks(memoryMap, tracksCount)
  File "C:\Users\***\AppData\Roaming\Blender Foundation\Blender\2.92\scripts\addons\animation_nodes\libs\midiparser\parser.py", line 130, in parseTracks
    return [MidiTrack.fromMemoryMap(memoryMap) for i in range(tracksCount)]
  File "C:\Users\***\AppData\Roaming\Blender Foundation\Blender\2.92\scripts\addons\animation_nodes\libs\midiparser\parser.py", line 130, in <listcomp>
    return [MidiTrack.fromMemoryMap(memoryMap) for i in range(tracksCount)]
  File "C:\Users\***\AppData\Roaming\Blender Foundation\Blender\2.92\scripts\addons\animation_nodes\libs\midiparser\parser.py", line 118, in fromMemoryMap
    events = parseEvents(memoryMap)
  File "C:\Users\***\AppData\Roaming\Blender Foundation\Blender\2.92\scripts\addons\animation_nodes\libs\midiparser\parser.py", line 101, in parseEvents
    event = parseEvent(memoryMap, parseState)
  File "C:\Users\***\AppData\Roaming\Blender Foundation\Blender\2.92\scripts\addons\animation_nodes\libs\midiparser\parser.py", line 87, in parseEvent
```

body:
I am finding that there are times when the "Is Inside Volume" node is freezing Blender. I am using Blender 2.90 on Ubuntu 20.04 installed via snap. Animation-Nodes is the latest version. Below is an image of my node tree.
![animationNode](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29495434/99871326-5d502b80-2ba7-11eb-9301-ca910fba0b72.png)
I am creating a number of Empties using a python script then looking to see if the empties are inside a volume. In the tree "Here" is a list of all the Empty positions. In this example I am just using a simple cube. There appear to be certain positions of the cube in the matrix of empties where everything freezes. If I hit ctrl-c in the console I can get control of Blender again but need to restart Blender to have Animation-Nodes work again. This is what the console shows after ctrl-c.
```

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/jim/.config/blender/2.90/scripts/addons/animation_nodes/execution/main_execution_unit.py", line 38, in executeUnit
    exec(self.executeCodeObject, self.executionData, self.executionData)

KeyboardInterrupt
```
`` When I run the node outside of a loop the same result is happening. I am attaching 2 images. The first one showing a position where the program freezes and the second one where it outputs correct results although it seems fairly random when everything freezes as I move the cube around using a mouse. Any ideas what is happening here?

title: setSplines crashes Blender during animation render
body:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1408875/95158570-a6127780-07e7-11eb-848e-449e84212830.png)


I have a tree that creates splines. It works well in the viewport, but Blender crashes during an animation render. This seems to happen in `graph_id_tag_update` in response to `curve_object_output:setSplines` (see [stack trace](https://github.com/JacquesLucke/animation_nodes/files/5331169/explosion7.crash.txt)).

To reproduce, open [spline_bug1.zip](https://github.com/JacquesLucke/animation_nodes/files/5331335/spline_bug1.zip) and render the animation (`Ctrl-F12`). It seems to be more likely to crash when the depsgraph has more work to do: if you reduce the number of particles, it won't crash as much. It usually only crashes when rendering the animation, not when playing it in the viewport. I only observed one such crash (see this [stack trace](https://github.com/JacquesLucke/animation_nodes/files/5331354/spline_bug1.crash.txt)).

AN version: 2.8.1
Blender versions: 2.90.1, 2.83lts
Platforms: Ubuntu (nVidia/Nouveau graphics), Mac OS (Intel graphics)

title: Sound Spectrum node bugs out after importing video to VSE
body:
I've been working on a project that needs audio visualization and I've decided that Animation Nodes is unquestionably the best way to go in terms of getting the kinds of things I want.
However, I've run into a major bug that happens to me quite consistently. I've done a lot of testing to try and figure out what is happening and why and here's what I have so far:

The sound spectrum node works as expected until you put a video with audio into the VSE. Then, no matter what you do, the sound spectrum node acts like any sound strip is a bunch of what looks like random noise (although the noise is different for each sound file and the noise seems most pronounced in the frequency ranges common in the file) for ~3-5 seconds before fading out (sometimes over ~1 second and sometimes almost instantly) to silence for the rest of the strip. Moving around the sound strip changes where this happens. Because of the way the noise appears similar to the original file (and what comes out of the speakers in the VSE,) I thought that maybe the sound spectrum node was looking at the sound of the last 100 frames of the audio strip (playing just the end) but this didn't seem to completely explain the node's outputs.

This happens to me even when the video and its audio is deleted and sticks with the save file independent of closing and opening Blender. I've found it is kind of like importing a movie permanently 'corrupts' the scene and any animation node tree based on that scene and working with sound strips in that scene's VSE will behave in this way. Creating a new scene in the same save file solves the issue (I assume because scenes have independent VSE saves) but putting a video in that scene will corrupt it too.

I'm working with Blender 2.83.5 and Animation Nodes 2.1 on MacOS 10.15.6. I first encountered the bug on AM 2.2 and re-installed AM with 2.1 (in case the experimental version was the problem) and also re-installed Blender 2.83.5 and restarted my computer but it keeps happening.

I have a Windows 10 computer as well and installed there (with Blender 2.83.0) just to see if the issue happened on Windows and I had a similar (but different) issue. After corrupting the scene by putting a video into the VSE, the sound spectrum node seemed to loosely follow the actual sound but the first 75% of the float indexes shared the same value.

title: Sound from Sequences / Sound Spectrum unable to get data or loses sync from edited sounds on VSE timeline
body:
I've been using AN for a good while on some productions where we use speech audio to drive animation and have just migrated to 2.8 and thus the new 2.1.x (initially v14 but today updated to v15 to see if it helped - it didn't)

What I'm seeing is that it works really well with the new live / realtime sound spectrum node but doesn't seem to allow easy editing of the audio channel in the same way the previous version did...

If I just let a single audio stream run, even if I move it on the timeline, it stays in sync all the way through but if I make a cut and the leave a gap, odd things happen - sometimes there's no signal at all, but mostly there is but it seems to lose sync. 

I've made up a small 
[sound nodes demo.zip](https://github.com/JacquesLucke/animation_nodes/files/3772051/sound.nodes.demo.zip)
file (attached) and I hope I've managed to pack the audio correctly to demonstrate this phenomenon...

cheers

Chris

title: Particle Data Node not updating while Render
body:
Blender: 2.8 (release)
Animation Nodes: 2.1.4 (graphicall release) 

Expected behavior
-------------------
The lamp moves with the particle on the provided sample file, when Auto Execution is enabled with always, or with frame change.

Current behavior
-------------------
With the new blender the 3D Viewport freezes its frame on render, and particles has the same position on the entire animation.

[AnimationNodesBug.zip](https://github.com/JacquesLucke/animation_nodes/files/3545372/AnimationNodesBug.zip)

title: Object Matrix Input does not work during Rendering
body:
As far as I can tell the "Object Matrix Input" node does not work when rendering an animation.
It just returns the same matrix every frame.
In the viewport it works as expected. It also bakes fine.

I tested this with the build from here: https://blender.community/c/graphicall/Xdbbbc/
On Windows 64 bit with the 2.80 release.

Here is a little file to reproduce this:
[animation_render_matrix.zip](https://github.com/JacquesLucke/animation_nodes/files/3511214/animation_render_matrix.zip)

The cube at the bottom has keyframes to move from left to right.
The nodes should
(1) make suzanne follow the cube and
(2) update the text at the top to show the position of the cube.

However, if you start an animation render, you will see that suzanne will stay in one place and the text will not update.

title: 2.80 linux version error:  NameError: name 'location' is not defined
body:
We found this issue on linux with several clients projects (can't share them unfortunately). It seems to affect only the Linux build, Windows and Mac do not have it.

On Linux, we are rendering from command line, but I tried command line on Windows as well, so I don't think this is what causes the issue.

Version affected: 2.1.4
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/blender/2.80/2.80/scripts/addons/animation_nodes/execution/main_execution_unit.py", line 38, in executeUnit
    exec(self.executeCodeObject, self.executionData, self.executionData)
  File "execution: 'Cross Cloud Atmosphere'", line 18, in <module>
NameError: name 'location' is not defined
```

title: Refresh all nodes in a newly appended node tree.
automatic vectorization does not work correctly when baking
cyclic dependencies with reroute nodes aren't resolved nicely
